posts.post_content: Hmm. It's either this or [Kuldotha Rebirth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Kuldotha Rebirth) for my favorite red common from Scars. They are both great cards for 1cmc, one gives you three creatures, one gives your threat double strike. Granted, The problem with this card is you have to be smart casting it or else they'll just chump block it. I would recommend [Panic Spellbomb](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Panic Spellbomb) or [Goblin Shortcutter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Goblin Shortcutter). This card takes prediction, but if you do it right, you'll deal a nice chunk of damage for just a small ammount of mana.

Posted By: Khultar (1/15/2011 11:06:41 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I really don't like this card... I drafted two because I thought it was an instant, I tried to play them as instants two or three times but my opponent's kept catching me...   
  
At sorcery speed it just mandates a chump block, and you can't use it on defense. It's really only good if you know that the creature is going to make it through, because you've nuked their blockers or your critter has some kind of evasion. Not NEARLY as good as [Berserk](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Berserk) or [Double Cleave](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Double Cleave) and really I'd rather have a [Giant Growth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Giant Growth) most of the time. This isn't a "combat trick"; your opponent sees it coming and you can't bluff with it.
posts.html:
I really don't like this card... I drafted two because I thought it was an instant, I tried to play them as instants two or three times but my opponent's kept catching me...

At sorcery speed it just mandates a chump block, and you can't use it on defense. It's really only good if you know that the creature is going to make it through, because you've nuked their blockers or your critter has some kind of evasion. Not NEARLY as good as Berserk or Double Cleave and really I'd rather have a Giant Growth most of the time. This isn't a "combat trick"; your opponent sees it coming and you can't bluff with it.
